intro: Galactia stereophylla, commonly known as the silverleaf galactia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it its common name. Galactia stereophylla is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert scrub habitats.
